questions:
What is the photo about?
A) Nature and landscapes
B) Daily life and people
C) Weather phenomena
D) Wildlife and animals

Where was the photo taken?
A) In a city park
B) At a beach
C) Inside a museum or exhibit
D) In a residential area

What is the main focus of the photo?
A) A painting
B) A tornado
C) A sculpture
D) A garden

What is in the center of the photo?
A) A tree
B) A television screen displaying a tornado
C) A person
D) A building

What is in the background of the photo?
A) A mountain range
B) An exhibit wall with information
C) A busy street
D) A forest

What is in the foreground of the photo?
A) A river
B) A display screen
C) A flower bed
D) A playground

What is the relationship between the foreground and background elements?
A) They are unrelated
B) They are part of an educational exhibit
C) They show a contrast between nature and technology
D) They depict a festive event

What kind of exhibit is likely depicted in the photo?
A) Art and culture
B) History and wars
C) Weather and natural phenomena
D) Marine life

What does the text on the left side of the photo likely describe?
A) Famous historical events
B) Different kinds of animals
C) The formation and impact of tornadoes
D) The process of making art

What is the color of the display screen's frame?
A) Red
B) Blue
C) Silver or gray
D) Black

What kind of weather event is shown on the screen?
A) A hurricane
B) A tornado
C) A thunderstorm
D) A snowstorm

What can be inferred about the location of the exhibit?
A) It is outdoors
B) It is in a natural park
C) It is indoors, likely in a museum or science center
D) It is in a shopping mall

What does the display screen show?
A) A peaceful nature scene
B) A weather phenomenon in action
C) A cityscape
D) A historical reenactment

What is the color of the sky in the image on the screen?
A) Clear blue
B) Cloudy and gray
C) Bright and sunny
D) Dark and stormy

How is the information about tornadoes presented in the exhibit?
A) Through interactive displays and text
B) Through videos and animations
C) Through live demonstrations
D) Through photographs and artifacts

What is the likely material of the display screen's frame?
A) Wood
B) Metal or plastic
C) Glass
D) Fabric

What does the presence of the display screen suggest about the exhibit?
A) It is outdated
B) It uses modern technology to educate
C) It is focused on historical artifacts
D) It is primarily for entertainment

What might be the height of the display screen?
A) Below knee level
B) Waist level
C) Eye level
D) Above head level

What is the overall theme of the exhibit?
A) Art and sculpture
B) Weather and natural disasters
C) Historical events
D) Modern technology

What kind of information is likely provided on the exhibit wall?
A) Steps to create a painting
B) Facts and figures about tornadoes
C) Historical timelines
D) Recipes and cooking tips

What is the significance of the tornado image on the screen?
A) It represents a common weather event
B) It illustrates the power and destruction of tornadoes
C) It shows a peaceful natural phenomenon
D) It depicts a fictional event

How does the exhibit engage visitors?
A) Through interactive and visual elements
B) Through live performances
C) Through hands-on activities
D) Through quiet contemplation

What kind of visual aids are used in the exhibit?
A) Paintings and sculptures
B) Photographs and videos
C) Maps and charts
D) Textiles and fabrics

What is the likely texture of the exhibit wall?
A) Smooth and glossy
B) Rough and textured
C) Soft and padded
D) Metallic and cold

What is the likely message of the exhibit?
A) The beauty of art
B) The power and danger of tornadoes
C) The history of human civilization
D) The joy of music and dance
